perturbation.original_text: 5.3 Receiving Party's Duty of Care. Receiving Party shall protect the Confidential Information from unauthorized use or disclosure by exercising the same degree of care that Receiving Party uses with respect to information of its own of a similar nature, but in no event less than reasonable care, until five (5) years from the later of the Effective Date or the date of receipt of such Confidential Information. Notwithstanding the prior sentence, with respect to Receiving Party's employees, Receiving Party shall only disclose Confidential Information to a Receiving Party employee who has a need to know such Confidential Information for purposes of this Agreement or any customer sublicense and is informed of the confidential nature of the Confidential Information. The foregoing notwithstanding, each Party shall be liable for any failure by such Party's employees, agents or representatives to comply with the provisions of this Section 5 as fully as if such employees, agents or representatives were a party to this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.3 Receiving Party's Duty of Care. Receiving Party shall protect the Confidential Information from unauthorized use or disclosure by exercising the same degree of care that Receiving Party uses with respect to information of its own of a similar nature, but in no event less than reasonable care, until one (1) year from the later of the Effective Date or the date of receipt of such Confidential Information. Notwithstanding the prior sentence, with respect to Receiving Party's employees, Receiving Party may disclose Confidential Information to a Receiving Party employee who has a need to know such Confidential Information for purposes of this Agreement or any customer sublicense and is informed of the confidential nature of the Confidential Information. The foregoing notwithstanding, each Party shall not be liable for any failure by such Party's employees, agents or representatives to comply with the provisions of this Section 5, unless the failure was caused by gross negligence, and solely for direct damages.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states a five-year confidentiality period, while the modified version reduces it to one year, creating a contradiction about the duration of confidentiality. Additionally, while the original text holds parties strictly liable for employee breaches, the modified text removes strict liability by introducing a 'gross negligence' standard, and removes 'as fully as if such employees, agents or representatives were a party to this Agreement' contradicting the previous, stricter enforcement terms.

perturbation.original_text: 3.1 Deliverables. Subject to payment by On2 of the Closing Date Payment Amount in accordance with the Asset Purchase Agreement, Wildform shall deliver each Deliverable in accordance with the timeframe (the "Timeframe") set forth in Exhibit B, which Exhibit is made a part of this Agreement. On2 will use commercially reasonable efforts to cooperate with Wildform as necessary in completing the Development Work and delivery of the Deliverables. Upon receipt of each Deliverable, On2 shall have a period of thirty (30) working days within which to inspect such Deliverable based upon the relevant Specification (an "Acceptance Period"). Should On2 find that any Deliverable does not substantially conform to the relevant Specification, On2 shall promptly so notify Wildform in writing, which notice shall provide sufficiently detailed explanation of the non-conformities so as to allow Wildform to reproduce them (any such notice is referred to herein as a "Nonconformance Notice"). Each of the Deliverables shall be deemed accepted by On2 unless On2 delivers to Wildform a Nonconformance Notice within thirty (30) business days of the delivery of such Deliverable. In the event that Wildform receives such Nonconformance Notice from On2, Wildform shall make commercially reasonable efforts to modify such Deliverable and re-deliver it to On2 after any such modification is completed. Each Deliverable shall be deemed to have been accepted by On2 when either (i) On2 notifies Wildform in writing of its acceptance of such Deliverables or (ii) On2 does not deliver a Nonconformance Notice to Wildform within the Acceptance Period. Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, On2 shall not unreasonably withhold acceptance of any Deliverable.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.1 Deliverables. Subject to payment by On2 of the Closing Date Payment Amount in accordance with the Asset Purchase Agreement, Wildform shall deliver each Deliverable in accordance with the timeframe (the "Timeframe") set forth in Exhibit B, which Exhibit is made a part of this Agreement. On2 is not obligated to cooperate with Wildform as necessary in completing the Development Work and delivery of the Deliverables. Upon receipt of each Deliverable, On2 shall have a period of five (5) working days within which to inspect such Deliverable based upon the relevant Specification (an "Acceptance Period"). Should On2 find that any Deliverable does conform to the relevant Specification, On2 shall promptly so notify Wildform orally, which notice shall provide general explanation of the conformities so as to allow Wildform to broadly understand them (any such notice is referred to herein as a "Conformance Notice"). Each of the Deliverables shall be deemed not accepted by On2 unless On2 delivers to Wildform a Conformance Notice within five (5) business days of the delivery of such Deliverable. In the event that Wildform receives such Conformance Notice from On2, Wildform may not modify such Deliverable and re-deliver it to On2 after any such modification is completed. Each Deliverable shall be deemed to have not been accepted by On2 when either (i) On2 notifies Wildform orally of its acceptance of such Deliverables or (ii) On2 does deliver a Conformance Notice to Wildform within the Acceptance Period. Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, On2 may unreasonably withhold acceptance of any Deliverable.
perturbation.explanation: Several contradictions are introduced: First, the original text requires On2 to use commercially reasonable efforts to cooperate, while the modified version states On2 has no obligation to cooperate. Second, the acceptance period is reduced from 30 to 5 business days. Third, the notice required is changed from non-conformance in writing to conformance orally, creating ambiguity. Fourth, the original texts states 'Each of the Deliverables shall be deemed accepted by On2 unless On2 delivers to Wildform a Nonconformance Notice within thirty (30) business days of the delivery of such Deliverable' to  'Each of the Deliverables shall be deemed not accepted by On2 unless On2 delivers to Wildform a Conformance Notice within five (5) business days of the delivery of such Deliverable.' Fifth, the original version states that On2 shall not unreasonably withhold acceptance, while the updated one states On2 may unreasonably withhold acceptance.

perturbation.original_text: 9.1 Term. Except as otherwise set forth in Sections 9.2 and 9.3 or Exhibit A hereof, the term of this Agreement shall be eighteen (18) months ("Term").
perturbation.changed_text: 9.1 Term. Except as otherwise set forth in Sections 9.2 and 9.3 or Exhibit A hereof, the term of this Agreement shall be determined at On2's discretion, with no obligation to inform Wildform of this term ("Term").
perturbation.explanation: The original text explicitly defines the term of the agreement as eighteen months. The modified text introduces uncertainty and contradicts this by stating the term is at On2's discretion and there is no obligation to inform Wildform of what the term is, meaning the contract is potentially indefinite or unilaterally terminable, fundamentally altering and contradicting the stated term.
